title: Performance optimization of metal-supported solid oxide fuel cells using cathode and full cell impregnation with La0.4Sr0.6Co0.2Fe0.7Nb0.1O3−δ electrode
content:
RSC Adv., 2024, 14,30460-30468
DOI: 10.1039/D4RA04253K, Paper
Open Access
  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Xin Song, Che Wang, Na Xu, Zhanlin Xu, Junling Meng
Metal-supported solid oxide fuel cells (MSCs) are optimized via cathode and full-cell impregnation with La0.4Sr0.6Co0.2Fe0.7Nb0.1O3−δ (LSCFN). Full-cell impregnation enhances stability in CH4 and boosts performance. Analyses include EIS, XPS, and SEM.
